clinical_study.brief_title: Relationship Between Gestational Diabetes Mellitus and Inflammatory Adipocytokins in Obese Mothers and Their Newborn at Delivery
clinical_study.official_title: Relation Entre diabète Gestationnel et Adipocytokines Inflammatoires Chez Des mères obèses et Leur Nouveau-né à l'Accouchement

lead_sponsor.agency: Centre Hospitalier Universitaire de la Réunion

clinical_study.source: Centre Hospitalier Universitaire de la Réunion

brief_summary.textblock: ADIPOGEST study aims at comparing circulating levels of inflammatory adipocytokins and C-reactive protein in obese women and their newborn at delivery whether exposed or not to Gestational Diabetes Mellitus (GDM)

detailed_description.textblock:
ADIPOGEST is a cross sectional study in which mothers are divided into 2 groups : exposed and unexposed to GDM, matched on pregestational BMI, date of delivery and child gender.
Mothers are recruited in the maternity ward of the University Hospital in South of Reunion Island.
It is planned a conveniance sample of 20 mother-child pairs per group.

primary_outcome.measure: Blood levels of leptin in mother and her child
Blood levels of adiponectin in mother and her child
Blood levels of IL-6 in mother and her child
Blood levels of TNF-alpha in mother and her child
Blood levels of C- Reactive Protein in mother and her child

secondary_outcome.measure: Blood level of C-peptide in mother

arm_group.description: Mother-child pairs from mothers with GDM diagnosis (ADA, 2012)
Mother-child pairs from mothers without GDM diagnosis (ADA, 2012)

biospec_descr.textblock: Leptin, adiponeptin, TNF-alpha, Interleukin-6, CRP and C-peptide blood levels

study_pop.textblock: Mother-child pairs from obese women with GDM or not

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant women
- Obese women (BMI : 30 kg/m² or more)
- Aged over 18 years
- With single pregnancy
- With alive newborn at 37 weeks of amenorrhea or more
- With informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Smoker
- Treatments by corticoïds or thyroid hormons
- Overt diabetes
- Complicated pregnancy
- Premature delivery threat
